job_title: Board Certified Behavior Analyst in Portage, MI
pros: The company values and mission are second to none; I've never met a more dedicated team of individuals.

review_title: A hidden secret of an employer, even though employing over 400 people.
pros: A nonprofit that is helping to give voice to those who are often overlooked or hidden away by society. Most of the management team has been with the company 15+ years (the organization is over 30 years old) and worked their way from entry-level to upper management. The benefits are excellent.
cons: For those who are serious about having a career, there are not many advancement opportunities within the program sites once the level of assistant has been reached. There are extremely rare opportunities for advancement within Administration. The pay rate for base staff is low considering what they do- however, this is a nonprofit organization that relies upon state/federal funding.

review_title: If you like being treated like crap...apply!
job_title: Direct Care Professional in Kalamazoo, MI
cons:
Program coordinators get paid to do absolutely nothing. They take all their misery out on employees and take all credit for themselves. The review about them throwing employees under the bus is 100% true. Management spends all their time sitting outside smoking and talking crap about all the employees. I mean I guess what should you expect when you have uneducated people in charge.

Unaffordable HMO insurance. Are you serious? Over $160 a month for SINGLE coverage. What a joke. That's a lot of money considering how under paid employees are. 

There are numerous instances where employees just didn't get paid on time because of "bank errors." Yeah right.

review_title: This employer has poor management in place and puts a lot of the blame on low level employees for their problems
job_title: Direct Care Aide in Kalamazoo, MI
pros:
ROI has really great benefits, Their health insurance is excellent and is very affordable
They also give quite a bit of Personal Time Off. There is some room for advancement into low level management.
cons:
Unprofessional low level staff
Ethical concerns
ROI tends to use low level staff as "scape" goats when they get "investigated" by the State
Management is also unprofessional ( they don't take responsibility for their problems and they try to put the blame on the lower level employees, there have also been instances of management stealing from residents and other workers)

job_title: Direct Support Professional in Kalamazoo, MI
pros:
I built relationships with lots of consumers.
Management tries to work with employees through anything.
Overtime and long shifts available.
cons:
A lot of student employees so the job is not a priority to many employees.
Call ins and major shortages.
No incentives for being an asset to the company.
Dead end job.
Injury precautions.
Poor employee standards (your co-workers switch from med students to crackheads randomly) based off of who can fill the shifts

pros: Management at the GLC is great. Most if not all of the people there are passionate about their jobs and really want to make a difference in clients lives.
cons: Training scheduling is horrendous and volatile. Especially the new hire training. If you are a new hire don't expect a training schedule until a week before you start and then expect it to change several times without much notice.
